records.caption: Elderly Care at Hospice Toronto.  Started 25 years ago, Hospice Toronto is Torontoâ€™s first volunteer and community-based, not for profit, in-home hospice palliative care program.  We're looking for volunteers - chat to us in the comments or post for us at http://www.hospicetoronto.ca/.

GlobalMedic is an NGO which helps people in need around the world by offering emergency relief services to aid victims of disasters and by training medical personnel and donating medicines to developing and war-torn countries. Volunteer duties range from disaster response, to organizing fundraising events, to helping pack for upcoming programs. If you have a positive attitude and a strong will to help those less fortunate, join at: http://www.globalmedic.ca/volunteer/
CanadaHelps is a registered charity with a goal to make giving simple.  http://www.canadahelps.org/

The Pathways to Education Program offers you an opportunity to make a long-lasting, positive difference in the lives of young people. As a volunteer with Pathways you are making a strong, collective statement about how much and how many people believe in the capabilities of our youth. Pathways to Education http://www.pathwaystoeducation.ca/en/take-action/volunteer

Get out and help us plant trees at the Brickworks this summer!  Other volunteer opportunities are available too.  Help us make Toronto green.  See here for more details.  http://www.evergreen.ca/get-involved/volunteer/volunteer-opportunities/
Give blood at Red Cross Toronto.  Your blood helps save lives! http://www.redcross.ca/
Clean the beach!  Find these items and post here!
